title: Jupyter Notebook Tutorial - Interactive Guide
description: Learn how to use Jupyter notebooks for cybersecurity education

instructions.title: 🚀 Welcome to Interactive Learning!
instructions.content:
Welcome to the Cloud Threat Graph Lab Jupyter Tutorial!

This guide will teach you everything you need to know to use Jupyter notebooks for cybersecurity learning.

🎯 What You'll Learn:

  • 🔧 How to run code cells (most important skill!)
  • 🗺️ Navigate the Jupyter interface
  • 🛠️ Troubleshoot common issues
  • 🔗 Connect to security learning
💡 Good News: Jupyter is easier than it looks! You'll be comfortable in just a few minutes.

instructions.title: 🔧 Most Important Skill: Running Code Cells
instructions.content:
The #1 skill you need: running code cells. Let's master this right now!

📋 Steps to Run a Cell:

  1. Click on the code cell (it gets a blue border)
  2. Press Shift + Enter (or click ▶️ play button)
  3. Wait for results (they appear below)
  4. Move to next cell (automatic or manual)

🎯 Try It Now: The cell below is your practice cell. Click on it and press Shift + Enter!

⚠️ Important: If nothing happens, make sure you clicked ON the gray cell (not just near it)!

instructions.title: ✅ Success Check: Did It Work?
instructions.content:
If you see a congratulations message above, you're doing great! 🎉

🔧 If it didn't work:

  • Make sure you clicked ON the gray code cell
  • The cell should have a blue border when selected
  • Try pressing Shift + Enter again
  • Or click the ▶️ play button in the toolbar

🧪 Let's Try Something Interactive: The next cell shows different results each time you run it. This demonstrates how notebooks can be dynamic and interactive!

💡 Pro Tip: You can run the same cell multiple times to see different results!

instructions.title: 🗺️ Understanding the Jupyter Interface
instructions.content:
Now that you can run cells, let's understand the Jupyter Lab interface!

🔍 Key Areas:

  • Left Sidebar: File browser (see all notebooks)
  • Main Area: Your notebook workspace
  • Top Toolbar: Run, stop, save buttons
  • Cell Types: Text (like this) and Code (gray background)

📱 Essential Buttons:

  • ▶️ Run: Execute the selected cell
  • ⏹️ Stop: Stop running code
  • 💾 Save: Save your progress
  • ➕ Add: Insert new cells
🎯 Navigation Tip: Use the left sidebar to switch between different learning notebooks!

instructions.title: 📖 The Golden Rule: Top to Bottom
instructions.content:
🥇 Golden Rule: Always run notebook cells from top to bottom!

🤔 Why Order Matters:

  • Later cells depend on earlier cells
  • Variables are defined in previous cells
  • Libraries are imported at the top
  • Skipping around causes errors

📚 Think of it like reading a book:

  1. Read the explanation (text cells)
  2. Run the code (code cells)
  3. See the results (output)
  4. Move to the next concept
✅ Best Practice: When in doubt, restart from the top and run all cells in order!

instructions.title: 🧪 Practice Time: Security Example
instructions.content:
Let's practice with a mini cybersecurity example! This simulates the kind of learning you'll do in the real notebooks.

🎯 Learning Goals:

  • Practice running cells in order
  • See how cells build on each other
  • Experience security-focused content
  • Understand the complete workflow

📋 Instructions:

  1. Run the "Setup" cell first
  2. Then run the "Analysis" cell
  3. Notice how the second cell uses data from the first
🎮 Real Learning Preview: This is exactly how the security notebooks work!

instructions.title: 📊 Continue the Security Analysis
instructions.content:
Now run the analysis cell to see how notebooks build on previous results!

🔍 What You Should Notice:

  • This cell uses data from the previous cell
  • It shows user information and attack paths
  • Results are formatted nicely for learning
  • This is exactly how real security analysis works

💡 Key Insight: If you tried to run this cell BEFORE the setup cell, you'd get an error because security_data wouldn't be defined!

🔧 Troubleshooting: If you get an error, go back and run the setup cell first!

instructions.title: 🛠️ Essential Troubleshooting Skills
instructions.content:
Every Jupyter user needs to know these troubleshooting techniques!

🚨 Common Problems & Solutions:

ProblemSolution
"Code won't run"Click on cell first, then Shift+Enter
"Variable not defined"Run cells from top to bottom
"Notebook seems frozen"Kernel → Restart Kernel
"Lost track of where I am"Use left sidebar Table of Contents

🔄 Nuclear Option: When all else fails, go to Kernel menu → Restart and Run All Cells

💡 Remember: These problems happen to everyone! Don't worry - just restart and try again.

instructions.title: 🎓 Your Learning Path to Security Expertise
instructions.content:
🏆 Congratulations! You now know how to use Jupyter notebooks!

✅ Skills You've Mastered:

  • 🔧 Running code cells with Shift+Enter
  • 🗺️ Navigating the Jupyter interface
  • 📖 Understanding top-to-bottom execution
  • 🛠️ Troubleshooting common issues

🚀 Ready for Security Learning:

  1. Start with: 01-Graph-Fundamentals.ipynb
  2. Practice with: Dashboard scenarios
  3. Advance to: 02-Attack-Path-Discovery.ipynb
  4. Master: All 10 attack scenarios

💡 Success Tips:

  • 🕒 Take your time - security concepts require practice
  • 🔄 Run cells multiple times to understand them
  • 🔗 Keep dashboard open to see connections
  • ❓ Use this tutorial as reference anytime

instructions.title: ✨ Ready to Become a Security Expert!
instructions.content:
🎉 You're ready to start your cybersecurity journey!

🔗 Next Steps:

  1. Close this tutorial (you can always come back)
  2. Open the file browser (left sidebar)
  3. Double-click: 01-Graph-Fundamentals.ipynb
  4. Start learning: Real security concepts!

🎮 Pro Learning Strategy:

  • 📱 Keep multiple browser tabs open:
  • 📚 This Jupyter Lab - for learning concepts
  • 🎮 Dashboard - for practicing scenarios
  • 🗃️ Neo4j Browser - for advanced queries

🎯 Remember the Goal:

You're not just learning Jupyter - you're building skills to protect real cloud systems from cyber attacks. Every concept connects to real-world security!

🚀 Let's go secure the cloud! 🛡️
